relationship_matrix.description: Power dynamics, tensions, and emotional connections between main characters in Terraform Protocol trilogy
relationship_matrix.format: Each relationship shows: power_dynamic (who has leverage), tension_type, emotional_foundation, and arc_trajectory

relationships.power_dynamic: Dmitri has institutional power, Kessa has knowledge power
relationships.emotional_foundation: Professional antagonism with grudging mutual respect
relationships.starting_state: Dmitri views Kessa as naive academic, Kessa sees him as corporate destroyer
relationships.arc_trajectory: Both realize they're victims of larger forces, develop complicated understanding but never full alliance
key_moments: Ch7: Dmitri suppresses Kessa's findings
Book 2, Ch11: Dmitri asks for Kessa's help to save his daughter
Book 3, Ch16: Both make sacrifices to enable compromise

relationships.power_dynamic: Shifts from Kessa's institutional power to Sage's contextual expertise
relationships.tension_type: Generational and philosophical - Earth-born vs. Mars-born identity
relationships.emotional_foundation: Mentor-student evolving to equals, genuine affection and mutual learning
relationships.starting_state: Kessa as established expert, Sage as local guide/assistant
relationships.arc_trajectory: Reverse mentorship as Sage teaches Kessa what Mars truly means, become partners
key_moments: Ch4: Sage demonstrates atmospheric adaptation to Kessa
Book 1, Ch18: Sage saves Kessa during colony destruction
Book 3, Ch12: Sage advocates for Kessa to merge with The Gardener

relationships.power_dynamic: Massively imbalanced - The Gardener can destroy all colonies, Kessa has only communication
relationships.tension_type: Existential - human survival vs. alien programming
relationships.emotional_foundation: Academic curiosity becomes understanding becomes merger
relationships.starting_state: Kessa studies The Gardener as artifact, it perceives her as contamination
relationships.arc_trajectory: From specimen/observer to communication partners to merged consciousness
key_moments: Ch1: Kessa discovers The Gardener's structure
Book 2, Ch17: First true communication established
Book 3, Ch12: Kessa offers to merge consciousness

relationships.power_dynamic: Zhang has military power, Kessa has moral authority
relationships.tension_type: Ethical dilemma - refugee survival vs. colony safety
relationships.emotional_foundation: Mutual respect complicated by impossible choices
relationships.arc_trajectory: Alliance forms as both seek solution that saves maximum lives
key_moments: Book 1, Ch15: First meeting, Zhang appeals to Kessa's humanity
Book 2, Ch19: Kessa provides archaeological data to help find safe landing sites
Book 3, Ch17: Both negotiate final compromise

relationships.power_dynamic: Dmitri has corporate authority, Sage has popular support
relationships.tension_type: Colonial - Earth empire vs. Mars independence
relationships.emotional_foundation: Mutual distrust verging on hatred, complicated by Sage being proof Dmitri's methods aren't needed
relationships.starting_state: Dmitri dismisses Sage as genetic experiment, Sage sees him as colonial oppressor
relationships.arc_trajectory: Never become allies, but gain tragic understanding as both lose what they fought for
key_moments: Ch9: Dmitri tries to buy Sage's silence about structure
Book 2, Ch8: Sage leads sabotage of Dmitri's terraforming operation
Book 3, Ch18: Both accept compromise neither wanted

relationships.power_dynamic: Uneasy equals - corporate vs. military authority
relationships.emotional_foundation: Shared desperation to save specific people (Dmitri's daughter, Zhang's refugees)
relationships.starting_state: Natural allies who both need refugees to land
relationships.arc_trajectory: Alliance strains as methods conflict, ultimately work together for compromise
key_moments: Book 1, Ch16: Form alliance to push for refugee landing
Book 2, Ch7: Zhang begins forced landings Dmitri didn't authorize
Book 3, Ch14: Zhang helps Dmitri get daughter to adapted colony

relationships.power_dynamic: The Gardener has absolute power, but recognizes Sage as 'successful gardener'
relationships.tension_type: Spiritual/philosophical - Sage sees The Gardener as Mars' soul
relationships.emotional_foundation: Reverential on Sage's side, recognition on The Gardener's
relationships.starting_state: The Gardener doesn't distinguish Sage from other humans initially
relationships.arc_trajectory: The Gardener recognizes Sage as adapted human who can survive Mars-as-it-is, validates Sage's existence
key_moments: Book 1, Ch19: Sage survives in area with active structure response
Book 2, Ch13: Sage helps establish communication protocols
Book 3, Ch10: The Gardener designates adapted zones for Sage's people

relationships.power_dynamic: Complex - Zhang has fleet weapons, Sage has home territory advantage
relationships.tension_type: Moral - both fighting for survival of their people, zero-sum game
relationships.emotional_foundation: Tragic opposition - neither wants to be enemies but circumstances force it
relationships.starting_state: Sage sees refugees as threat, Zhang sees Sage as obstacle
relationships.arc_trajectory: From enemies to reluctant acknowledgment to cooperation in adapted refugee program
key_moments: Book 2, Ch4: Sage leads resistance against refugee landings
Book 2, Ch15: Zhang saves Sage during structure attack, shifts dynamic
Book 3, Ch9: Sage accepts some refugees can adapt, Zhang provides volunteers

relationships.power_dynamic: The Gardener can destroy fleet, Zhang can damage surface colonies
relationships.emotional_foundation: Zhang views The Gardener as obstacle, The Gardener sees fleet as contamination source
relationships.arc_trajectory: Zhang comes to accept The Gardener's judgment has validity, seeks negotiated peace
key_moments: Book 2, Ch7: Fleet landings trigger major structure responses
Book 2, Ch20: Zhang acknowledges The Gardener has legitimate claim
Book 3, Ch17: Zhang agrees to compromise that accepts The Gardener's authority

power_triangles.name: Knowledge Triangle
power_triangles.dynamic: Each has different knowledge type - academic, corporate, lived experience
power_triangles.outcome: Must combine all three knowledge types to find solution

power_triangles.name: Authority Triangle
power_triangles.dynamic: Corporate power vs. military power vs. absolute planetary power
power_triangles.outcome: All three authority types prove insufficient alone

power_triangles.name: Future Triangle
power_triangles.dynamic: Three possible futures for Mars - adapted humans, alien ecosystem, terraformed world
